deaf

sentences.english: Some fell on deaf ears-wilfully deaf, in the case of the European left.
sentences.chinese: 有些人确故意装聋作哑，比如欧洲的左派。

sentences.english: He’d hint at his dissatisfaction, and I’d play dumb.
sentences.chinese: 他会对我暗示自己的不满，对此我装聋作哑。

sentences.english: They knew that discrimination was going on, but chose to ignore it.
sentences.chinese: 他们当时知道歧视现象仍然存在，但是宁愿装聋作哑。

sentences.english: In Europe it is apparent that the referees have an ignorance problem.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲赛场上，裁判们似乎都明显地爱装聋作哑。

sentences.english: Had he been on deck, he could no longer so much as have pretended not to understand the situation.
sentences.chinese: 要是他留在甲板上，他就无法再装聋作哑。

sentences.english: Don't play dumb with me. If you think you can fool me, you are sorely mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 别跟我装聋作哑，如果你以为能骗我，就大错特错了。

to keep silent (idiom)

definition: to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
a wise man looks after his own hide (idiom)/to put one's own safety before matters of principle
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned

to turn a blind eye

definition: to act stupid/to pretend to be naive
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
not to get involved/to stay out of it
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to keep the peace; to patch up a quarrel (idiom)
to play dumb/to slack off (idiom)
